name: Concept: Workflow runbook with SuccessGateway
description: This is a concept runbook that delivers and uses the GW_Success automation.

steps.description:
This is a sample runbook provided to show the concept of reacting on the output of a "Multi Target Automation"

This runbook shows how to react / cleanup on those systems where an automation was not successful.




As runbook steps this is translated to::

(Start) Step 2 Find affected systems
Step 3 Try to patch the systems
(Condition) Step 4 Use GW Automation as condition to create target list with [0..n] hostnames.
Get list of hostname on which patch was unsuccessfull
Use as Input the MTA output of Step 3
(Conditional) Step 5 Force another patch. Make the system clean again.
Use as Input results calculated in Step 4
(Condition) Step 6 Use GW Automation as condition to create target list with [0..n] hostnames.
Get list of hostname on which patch was failed
Use as Input the MTA output of Step 3
(Conditional) Step 7 Check if system is still available via PING.
Use as Input results calculated in Step 6
(End)

This automation simply prints a list of <OS> <HOSTNAME> <A_COMPONENT> out.
It is just for demo purposes to show the concept. If you want to use this runbook and run in you environment than you have to edit this automation and add a list of real HOSTNAMES to be printed instead.

This step uses the output of previous step to create a Key=Value list for the GW Automation in next step.
If the Automation in previous step is already able to provide this Key=Value list then this automation can be omitted.

Notice: Do not skip execution of this automation - the result of this automation is being used as one input of the Gateway Automation in step 5.

Calc Patch Systems by OS

This step simulates a required patch on the systems which have been "calculated" in step before.
Since this is only a demonstration runbook  - no patch will be done. Instead we list the installation information of the package name being provided a runbook parameter and passed to a parameter of the following automation.

Display Package Info

This step analyzes the output of the Multi-Target Automation (MTA) which ran in previous step. As result of this automation an MTA target list is being created of systems on which the automation of Step 3 was UNSUCCESSFUL.

GW Get Target List By State

In this step we handle those systems with a special automation on which the mitigation step was

   UNSUCCESSFUL. If the list created in previous step is empty - then the mitigation was not unsuccessful

  anywhere and following automation is not running.

  Get TOP Processes

List the systems on which the previous automation was FAILED

GW Get Target List By State

In this step we handle those systems with a special automation on which the mitigation step was

  FAILED. If the list created in previous step is empty - then the mitigation was not failing anywhere

  and following automation is not running.

  Get TOP Processes

parameters.name: PACKAGENAME
parameters.description: This is the package name to be checked with yum

exportedAutomation_0_.name: GW Get Target List By State
exportedAutomation_0_.description:
This GW automation is intended to return the list of systems on which a MTA did run (SUCCESSFUL | UNSUCCESSFUL | FAILED) before. 
The returned list can be used as target for another MTA in order to run for example a cleanup script, where needed.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Target system where the script will be executed

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User ID that is used to run the script

parameters.name: $MTAOUTPUT
parameters.description: Specify the output of an MTA

parameters.name: $STATUS
parameters.description: This is the STATUS for which the list is required (UNSUCCESSFUL | SUCCESSFUL | FAILED)

exportedAutomation_1_.name: Get TOP Processes
exportedAutomation_1_.description: This automation calls the standard Unix TOP command to list a system summary as well as current existing processes and threads.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Target system where the script will be executed

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User ID that is used to run the script

parameters.name: $Iterations
parameters.description: Number of Iterations to run by top before to stop

exportedAutomation_2_.name: Display Package Info
exportedAutomation_2_.description: This automation simply uses "yum" to display the information of the package which has been specified by parameter.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Target system where the script will be executed

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User ID that is used to run the script

parameters.name: $PACKAGE
parameters.description: The name of the package to be checked

exportedAutomation_3_.name: Calc Patch Systems by OS
exportedAutomation_3_.description: This returns the number of systems to be pathched by OS

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Target system where the script will be executed

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User ID that is used to run the script
